intro: Lithocardium cordifolium, commonly known as the heart-leaved lithocardium, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming during the cooler months. Lithocardium cordifolium is adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
